FacilityName: McCain Foods USA, Inc., Burley, Idaho

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Frozen Fruit, Juice, and Vegetable Manufacturing
Frozen Fruit, Juice, and Vegetable Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
McCain Foods USA, Inc. is committed to being a responsible member of the community by giving top priority to operating in a safe and environmentally sound manner.  McCain's Burley facility is a potato processing plant which produces frozen potato products, such as French Fries and tater tots, for the retail and service markets.  Ammonia, a regulated toxic substance, is used in the refrigeration systems at the facility.  The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation.



A. Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



McCain Foods uses many precautionary measures to prevent or minimize the accidental release of ammonia from the refrigeration systems.  These precautions include built in safety systems that will generate alarms or automatically shut down the refrigeration system if design limitations are exceeded (eg. Pressures, temperatures, or vessel operating levels).  These safety systems in conjunction with PLC automated control ensure that the system operates within safe limits minimizing the chance for an ammonia release to occur.  A comprehensive Preventative Maintenance program is used to ensure the on-going mechanical integrity of all equipment in the refrigeration systems.  Refrigeration mechanics and operators are trained to maintenance and operating procedures to minimize the chance of human error and to maintain a well informed and qualified group of refrigeration personnel





B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled



There are three ammonia refrigeration systems at the Burley facility.  Ammonia is the only substance handled at the Burley facility covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations.





C. Accidental Release Prevention Program



The facility has an accidental release prevention program that complies with OSHA's Process Safety Management standard and the EPA's Risk Management Program regulation. The

prevention program consists of the following elements:

- Empoyee Participation

- Process Safety Information

- Process Hazard Analysis

- Operating Procedures

- Employee Training

- Contractor Safety

- Pre-startup Safety Review Procedures

- Mechanical Integrity (Preventative Maintenance Program)

- Hot Work Permit (Non-routine Work Authorizations)

- Management of Change Procedures

- Incident Investigation Procedures

- Compliance Audit Procedures





D. Five Year Accident History



No ammonia-related incidents have occurred at the Burley facility over the past five years that resulted in significant on-site or off-site consequences.





E. Emergency Response Program



An emergency action plan has been implemented at the Burley facility. This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia releases and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures. This program has been coordinated with the Cassia County LEPC.





F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



All ammonia releases, regardless of size, are investigated following incident investigation procedures. The objective is to identify recommendations that will prevent these releases from re-occurring. Safety improvements are made to equipment and procedures using this technique to continually improve the safety of the ammonia refrigeration systems at the Burley facility.
